3. Sie geht die Treppe hinauf. → She is walking [_up] the stairs.
4. Mein Auto ist auf der linken Straßenseite. → My car is [_on] the left side of the road.
5. Max steht zwischen Doris und Tim. → Max is standing [_between] Doris and Tim.
6. Wir unterhielten uns über die Geschichte. → We talked [_about] the story.
7. Ich mag es, unter Freunden zu sein. → I like being [_among] friends.
8. Er fuhr von Berlin nach München. → He went [_from] Berlin to Munich.
9. Das Bild hing über der Tür. → The picture hung [_above] the door.
10. Meine Schwester ist an einer kleinen Schule. → My sister is [_at] a small school.

3. Die Kinder rennen den Hügel hinunter. → The children are runnning [_down] the hill.
4. Der Mann ging auf den Fluss zu. → The man went [_towards] the river.
5. Er ging am Fluss entlang. → He went [_along] the river.
6. Das Auto wurde gegen eine Mauer gefahren. → The car was driven [_against] the wall.
7. Die Jungs gingen durch den Wald. → The boys went [_through] the forest.
8. Peter sitzt am Tisch. → Peter is sitting [_at] the table.
9. Es gibt drei Ozeane auf der Erde. → There are three oceans [_on] earth.
10. Der Amazonas ist der längste Fluss der Welt. → The Amazon ist the longest river [_in] the world.

bitmark:

[@id:218293]
[%Nr. 3028]
[!Wähle die richtige Präposition aus.]

I'm Peter and I live [-of][-at][+in] Germany. [+In][-During][-At] summer I like to travel [-after][+to][-towards] Italy, because [-by][-from][+of] the weather and the people there. Last summer I took a plane [+from][-over][-against] Munich to Rome. 
[+From][-On][-After] the airport we went to our hotel [+by][-with][-on] bus. We stopped [-between][-up][+at] a small restaurant for a quick meal. The driver parked the bus [+behind][-over][-below] the restaurant. Nobody could find the bus and the driver, so we waited [+outside][-down][-on] the restaurant [+for][-in][-through] one hour. The driver was walking [-across][+through][-off] the small park [+near][-over][-around] the restaurant which we did not know. So we were very angry [-along][+with][-over] him. But my holidays were great. We sat [-over][-at][+round] campfires and went dancing [-for][-against][+till] the early mornings.

bit.body:
I'm Peter and I live {0} Germany. {1} summer I like to travel {2} Italy, because {3} the weather and the people there. Last summer I took a plane {4} Munich to Rome. 
{5} the airport we went to our hotel {6} bus. We stopped {7} a small restaurant for a quick meal. The driver parked the bus {8} the restaurant. Nobody could find the bus and the driver, so we waited {9} the restaurant {10} one hour. The driver was walking {11} the small park {12} the restaurant which we did not know. So we were very angry {13} him. But my holidays were great. We sat {14} campfires and went dancing {15} the early mornings.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:218299]
[%Nr. 3042]
[!Wähle aus den Vorgaben die richtigen Präpositionen aus und ergänze so die Fragen.]

1. What happened [-at][+in][-of][-on] the morning [-at][-in][+of][-on] 18th April [-at][+in][-of][-on] 1906? (San Francisco earthquake)
2. What happened [-at][-in][-of][+on] 20th July [-at][+in][-of][-on] 1969 [+at][-in][-of][-on] about 3 am? (Landing on the Moon – Apollo 11)
3. What happened [-at][+in][-of][-on] 1957 [-at][-in][-of][+on] 4th October [+at][-in][-of][-on] about 7:30 pm? (The Soviet Union successfully launched Sputnik I.)
4. What happened [-at][+in][-of][-on] the evening [-at][-in][+of][-on] 9th November  [-at][+in][-of][-on]1989? (The fall of the Berlin Wall began.)
5. What happened [-at][+in][-of][-on] 2002 [-at][-in][-of][+on] 1st January? (The Euro became the official currency of 12 European countries.)
6. What happened [-at][+in][-of][-on] the morning  [-at][-in][+of][-on]18th August [-at][+in][-of][-on] 1969? (The Woodstock Festival ended.)
7. What happened [-at][-in][-of][+on]  November 22 [+at][-in][-of][-on] about 12:30 pm  [-at][+in][-of][-on]1963? (Assassination of John F. Kennedy)
8. What happened [-at][+in][-of][-on] 1953 [-at][-in][-of][+on] 29th May [+at][-in][-of][-on] about 11:30 am? (Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay became the first explorers to reach the summit of Mount Everest.)
9. What happened [-at][+in][-of][-on] the morning [-at][-in][+of][-on] 2nd September  [-at][+in][-of][-on]1666? (The Great Fire of London)
10. What happened [-at][-in][-of][+on] 15th August [-at][+in][-of][-on] 1914? (The Panama Canal was opened to traffic.)

bit.body:
1. What happened {0} the morning {1} 18th April {2} 1906? (San Francisco earthquake)
2. What happened {3} 20th July {4} 1969 {5} about 3 am? (Landing on the Moon – Apollo 11)
3. What happened {6} 1957 {7} 4th October {8} about 7:30 pm? (The Soviet Union successfully launched Sputnik I.)
4. What happened {9} the evening {10} 9th November  {11}1989? (The fall of the Berlin Wall began.)
5. What happened {12} 2002 {13} 1st January? (The Euro became the official currency of 12 European countries.)
6. What happened {14} the morning  {15}18th August {16} 1969? (The Woodstock Festival ended.)
7. What happened {17}  November 22 {18} about 12:30 pm  {19}1963? (Assassination of John F. Kennedy)
8. What happened {20} 1953 {21} 29th May {22} about 11:30 am? (Edmund Hillary and Tenzing Norgay became the first explorers to reach the summit of Mount Everest.)
9. What happened {23} the morning {24} 2nd September  {25}1666? (The Great Fire of London)
10. What happened {26} 15th August {27} 1914? (The Panama Canal was opened to traffic.)
bit.instruction: Wähle aus den Vorgaben die richtigen Präpositionen aus und ergänze so die Fragen.

bitmark:
[.cloze:bitmark--]
[@id:218300]
[%Nr. 3024]
[!Schreibe die richtigen Präpositionen in die Lücken.]

0. Look! The people are getting [_on][@example] the train.
1. She was born [_in] 2004.
2. They are waiting [_for] the bus.
3. Don't forget to bring some flowers [_with] you.
4. I haven't smoked [_in] ages.
5. You can look up the word [_in] a dictionary.
6. She is allergic [_to] insect stings.
7. I'm looking [_for] my keys. Have you found them?
8. The song was written [_by] Madonna.
9. He likes to travel [_to] Spain in summer.
10. The police car chased the robbers [_through] the streets.

bit.body:
0. Look! The people are getting {0} the train.
1. She was born {1} 2004.
2. They are waiting {2} the bus.
3. Don't forget to bring some flowers {3} you.
4. I haven't smoked {4} ages.
5. You can look up the word {5} a dictionary.
6. She is allergic {6} insect stings.
7. I'm looking {7} my keys. Have you found them?
8. The song was written {8} Madonna.
9. He likes to travel {9} Spain in summer.
10. The police car chased the robbers {10} the streets.
bit.instruction: Schreibe die richtigen Präpositionen in die Lücken.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:218301]
[%Nr. 3026]
[!Finde zu den Verben auf der linken Seite die passendste Verbindung. Beachte die Präpositionen.]

1. hang [-at the airport][-behind the tree][-during the night][-on the beach][-on the phone][-out of the window][+out with friends][-outside the stadium][-to music][-to the swimming pool]
2. listen [-at the airport][-behind the tree][-during the night][-on the beach][-on the phone][-out of the window][-out with friends][-outside the stadium][+to music][-to the swimming pool]
3. talk [-at the airport][-behind the tree][-during the night][-on the beach][+on the phone][-out of the window][-out with friends][-outside the stadium][-to music][-to the swimming pool]
4. go [-at the airport][-behind the tree][-during the night][-on the beach][-on the phone][-out of the window][-out with friends][-outside the stadium][-to music][+to the swimming pool]
5. arrive [+at the airport][-behind the tree][-during the night][-on the beach][-on the phone][-out of the window][-out with friends][-outside the stadium][-to music][-to the swimming pool]
6. look [-at the airport][-behind the tree][-during the night][-on the beach][-on the phone][+out of the window][-out with friends][-outside the stadium][-to music][-to the swimming pool]
7. sleep [-at the airport][-behind the tree][+during the night][+on the beach][-on the phone][-out of the window][-out with friends][-outside the stadium][-to music][-to the swimming pool]
8. lie [-at the airport][-behind the tree][-during the night][-on the beach][-on the phone][-out of the window][-out with friends][-outside the stadium][-to music][-to the swimming pool]
9. wait [-at the airport][-behind the tree][-during the night][-on the beach][-on the phone][-out of the window][-out with friends][+outside the stadium][-to music][-to the swimming pool]
10. hide [-at the airport][+behind the tree][-during the night][-on the beach][-on the phone][-out of the window][-out with friends][-outside the stadium][-to music][-to the swimming pool]

bit.instruction: Finde zu den Verben auf der linken Seite die passendste Verbindung. Beachte die Präpositionen.

bitmark:
[.multiple-choice-text:bitmark--]
[@id:218302]
[%Nr. 3044]
[!Wähle von den Präpositionen **as**, **for**, **of**, **to**, **with** die richtige aus und vervollständige die Wortgruppe.]

0. on top [+of][@example]
1. in front [-as][-for][+of][-to][-with]
2. as far [+as][-for][-of][-to][-with]
3. in answer [-as][-for][-of][+to][-with]
4. on behalf [-as][-for][+of][-to][-with]
5. in agreement [-as][-for][-of][-to][+with]
6. by means [-as][-for][+of][-to][-with]
7. with reference [-as][-for][-of][+to][-with]
8. in order [-as][-for][-of][+to][-with]
9. in compensation [-as][+for][-of][-to][-with]
10. with compliments [-as][-for][+of][-to][-with]

bit.instruction: Wähle von den Präpositionen **as**, **for**, **of**, **to**, **with** die richtige aus und vervollständige die Wortgruppe.
